heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 2nd in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 4th since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 10 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (201°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 9%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.9°C), inside temperature (up 1.8°C), and cloud levels (up 715 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 785.7m higher than yesterday, 346.0m higher than the past week, 714.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1896.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1550.2m and 2610m.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and strong and powerful sunlight. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
